text: are you looking for something really
rich and delicious to take with you on
your next picnic as a treat I have just
the recipe for you it's a super easy
rocky road bar the base is made with
graham crackers I'm just lining a 9 by
13 inch baking dish with graham crackers
you'll need about I don't know I'd say
eight or ten graham crackers can break
up the last ones if you need to and then
bake this at 375 degrees until they're
fragrant and warm should take about
eight minutes I have one and a half cups
of toasted almonds previously toasted
not salted and you're just gonna want to
chop them coarsely I'm using my handy
dandy serrated knife which makes so easy
to chop nuts I'm just gonna put them
back in the bowl so I have my board
clear and then I'm gonna melt together
twelve ounces of chocolate chips just
regular old sweet semi-sweet chocolate
chips and a 14 ounce can of sweetened
condensed milk and all you need to do is
melt these together over a double boiler
probably gonna want to stir it every
once in a while basically you're making
the world's easiest fudge and who
doesn't want the world's easiest fudge
recipe I know you do throw these
together until they're smooth and all
the chocolate chips are melted really
quick while this is melting I'll keep an
eye on it but I'm going to take my
graham crackers out of the oven sprinkle
them with the almonds plenty of almonds
so be generous time is of the essence
hurry dollop the top with a cup of
marshmallow cream otherwise known as
fluff it's super sticky I find that
using two spoons is super helpful for
not getting your fingers sticky I do
feel like I'm a little bit playing with
wire here and leaving my chocolate over
there slightly unattended I mean I'm
keeping my eye on it but bad things
happen when you leave chocolate
unattended heed my warning give it one
more stir me
sure everything is nicely melted and
smooth you see how shiny it is that
looks perfect to me now pour this over
the top
spread the chocolate over the top it
doesn't matter that much if the almond
sort of mix in because what's what
you're doing you're making a rocky road
bar everything is all mixed together
anyway kind of want to work quickly at
this point and it definitely helps if
your graham crackers are still warm so
time it properly so that your chocolate
mixture which took about five minutes to
melt comes off around the same time that
your graham crackers come out of the
oven and then just swirl it a little bit
and then you have your marshmallow cream
and your nuts and your chocolate all
mixed together and then just set it in
the refrigerator for about an hour and
then you can cut it up and pack it and
take it with you if you can wait when
they've set they're ready to cut and
consume the most important thing you
could just cut them right in the pan I'm
using a paring knife and they lift right
out wrap these up in a little bit of
parchment paper you're gonna want to
keep these cool but bring them on your
next picnic and I'm sure they're gonna
be a huge huge hit mmm and you do not
have to tell anybody how easy they were
or you could rhyme about it
hi guys thanks for watching this video
